Sentencas: The paper focuses on the design of a procedure for the development of an on-field diagnostic algorithm for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) systems.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: The diagnosis design phase relies on an in-deep analysis of the mutual interactions among all system components by exploiting the physical knowledge of the SOFC system as a whole.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: This phase consists of the Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), which identifies the correlations among possible faults and their corresponding symptoms at system components level.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: The main outcome of the FTA is an inferential isolation tool (Fault Signature Matrix - FSM), which univocally links the faults to the symptoms detected during the system monitoring.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: In this work the FTA is considered as a starting point to develop an improved FSM.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: Making use of a model-based investigation, a fault-to-symptoms dependency study is performed.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: To this purpose a dynamic model, previously developed by the authors, is exploited to simulate the system under faulty conditions.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: Five faults are simulated, one for the stack and four occurring at BOP level.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis

Sentencas: Moreover, the robustness of the FSM design is increased by exploiting symptom thresholds defined for the investigation of the quantitative effects of the simulated faults on the affected variables.
Titulo: Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis
Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis
Model-based development of a fault signature matrix to improve solid oxide fuel cell systems on-site diagnosis
